newsitem.title: USA: Acacia buys majority stake in Soundview.
newsitem.headline: Acacia buys majority stake in Soundview.

text.p: Acacia Research Corp said Monday it acquired majority ownership of Soundview Technologies Inc in a transaction valued at $4.2 million.
The purchase price for 35 percent of Soundview's outstanding stock consists of 400,000 shares of Acacia Research's common stock, $500,000 in cash, and a $900,000 note.
The deal increased Acacia Research's ownership interest to 51.4 percent from 16.4 percent.

Acacia said Soundview Technologies, a private company, owns technology relating to the V-chip, a television feature that allows parents and other viewers to block programs that, based on information provided by a common rating system, they believe are inappropriate.
